entities.game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.game.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game handles all information about any game.

    For the command-line argument for connecting to a server the wildcard '?' is used to be replaced with the ip-address of the lan-server joining to.


    Example for a Game property file:
    file.server = cod2.zip [filename on the LANServer]
    exe.file = COD2MP_s.exe [path of the games exe-file]
    exe.server = [empty if no special server-exe is needed]
    exe.param = [command-line arguments for the normal game start]
    exe.server.param = +set dedicated 1 +map mp_carentan [standard command-line arguments for the server start]
    name = Call of Duty 2 [name of the game]
    version.format = file [allowed: exe, file]
    version.file = version.inf [file to determine the version-information from]
    version.query = ExtVersion= [query to search the file for the version-information]
    version = 1.3 [version of the game on the LANServer]
    connect.direct = true
    connect.param = +connect ? [command-line arguments if connecting to a server; '?' is the wildcard for the ip-address]
    openserver = true
    cover.url = [URL from the Web or any local used cover, else empty]

    Since:
    1.0

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String versionServer,
            java.lang.String connectParam,
            java.lang.String exeFileRelative,
            java.lang.String coverUrl,
            java.lang.String serverFileName,
            java.lang.String param,
            boolean connectDirect,
            Game.Version version,
            java.lang.String exeServerRelative,
            java.lang.String serverParam,
            boolean openServer)
        Creates the Game with the given information.

        versionServer can be empty if no version can be determined from the Game. The coverUrl can be empty if no local coverfile should be used and the cover send from the server will be used.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the Game
        versionServer - gameversion available on the LANServer
        connectParam - used command-line arguments for joining a lan-server (see getConnectParam())
        exeFileRelative - relative path of the exe-file within the gamefolder
        coverUrl - absolute path to the coverfile
        serverFileName - full filename of the Game on the LANServer
        param - command-line arguments used to start the Game and when joining a lan-server
        connectDirect - true if there are command-line arguments for joining a lan-server
        version - Game.Version of the Game locally available
        exeServerRelative - relative path of the exe-file within the gamefolder, if there is any
        serverParam - command-line argument used for starting a lan-server
        openServer - true if there are command-line arguments for starting a lan-server
        Since:
        1.0

      • isUptodate

        public int isUptodate()
        Returns:
        -1 if the Game is not locally available, -2 if no version can be determined, -3 if the local version is not equal with the version on the LANServer, 0 if the local version is the same as the version on the LANServer
        Since:
        1.0
